author: Laura Saunders
title: Who Will and Won’t Pay the AMT, America’s Rich-Person Tax?
text:
The Alternative Minimum Tax isn’t out, but it is way, way down.
The AMT is a complex and controversial levy that raises taxes by limiting the value of certain breaks. Originally enacted in 1969 to ensure that the highest earners paid some tax, it wound up hitting even filers making $200,000. Republicans vowed to repeal the AMT as part of last year’s overhaul but retained a version of it in the final bill.
